title: Love Island's Yewande Biala on 'insane' Twitter debate about her looks
text:
Yewande Biala came to fame thanks to her stint on Love Island (Picture: Backgrid)

Yewande Biala became a household name thanks to her stint on Love Island this summer.

While she may not have found love in the villa, the 23-year-old has been making the most of her newfound fame, and recently launched her own In The Style collection.

However, it hasn’t been all fun and games since she returned home from Majorca.

In fact, despite barely being active on the platform, she is currently the fourth top Twitter trend in the UK, as a vicious and bizarre debate rages on about her looks.

Yes, seriously.

Countless people have absolutely nothing to do with their days than discuss whether or not she is pretty – and the scientist has had enough of it.

In an exclusive chat with Metro.co.uk at the launch of her In The Style collection, she told us: ‘The last couple of days I think there’s been people debating whether they find me attractive or not. Isn’t that insane?

Yewande opened up about the debate over her looks (Picture: In The Style)

‘It’s been on Twitter for the last few days, I’ve even seen a Tweet today like, “You guys are trying to force Yewande on us like the way you forced Lupita [Nyong’o]”.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘There’s a huge thing about dark-skinned women and whether society finds them beautiful, and whether they find me beautiful because I’m dark-skinned.

‘It has been an issue that’s been going on for the last three days, it’s like, “Are you not tired?” It’s so mad.’

And it’s not just faceless people on Twitter, but those that Yewande meets in public as well.

Yewande feels ‘like that ugly friend’ amid the debate (Picture: Rex)

She continued: ‘Anytime I meet people, [they say] “Oh my god you’re so pretty” but it’s not like, “Oh you’re so pretty”. It’s more of, “Oh I see all the backlash you’re getting and I just want you to know I find you attractive.”

‘I just feel like that ugly friend who people have to tell they’re really pretty because like, they feel sorry for them.’

The ITV2 star explained that’s often the hardest part of life after the Love Island villa.

‘People feel like they have to have opinions. They forget I am a real person, I do see these comments,’ she added.

‘I don’t see all of them, but I do see it, I have feelings like everybody else. But I just try not to let it phase me, and just try and move on, really.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘It’s just like people having an opinion of you without even knowing you like positive or negative, it’s hard sometimes.’

Yewande Biala’s In The Style Power Edit is available now.

description: Love Island's Yewande Biala opens up about 'insane' Twitter debate regarding her looks and dark-skinned women
